CatDescriptText: Sam Carter, steelworker, Fifth Ward and George Young, hotel worker, Homewood, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, July 23, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "What do you think is the number one problem for city officials to solve in the redevelopment program?  Why?"  Mr. Carter's answer reads: "The greatest need now is better houses, especially for colored people.  At present they are paying high rents and not living in decent places."  Mr. Young's answer reads: "I think that the redevelopers should see that the displaced people have a decent place in which to live.  I mean not only those displaced by the lower Hill program, but also those who will be displaced in the future."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Sam Carter wearing light colored button down collared shirt and eyeglasses, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of George Young wearing checkered button down collared shirt and hat with striped band, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
